text:
The Madras High Court has ordered notice to the State government on a plea moved by the Pattali Makkal Katchi (PMK) seeking to quash the order of the Superintendent of Police, Kancheepuram, denying permission for the party to organise a State-level political conference in a private land located on the Vandalur-Urapakkam GST Road.

The party’s deputy general secretary, K. Arumugam, moved that High Court submitting that in view of the general election for Tamil Nadu Assembly due to be held tentatively in April-May 2016, the PMK has planned to hold a State-level political conference in Chennai.

“The party has identified ‘VGP Thidal’, a private property owned by V.G.P and Co in Kancheepuram district. Due permission has been sought from the property owner,” the petitioner said.

Pointing out that the Bharatiya Janata Party and Vanigar Sanga Peravai had organised public meetings in the ground in 2014 and 2015 respectively, the petitioner sought permission to conduct the meeting on February 14 with the Superintendent of Police, Kancheepuram.

Police return application

But through an order dated January 08, the police returned the application moved by the petitioner, directing him to get permission from the revenue authorities concerned for utilising the land and then apply for permission form the police.

Assailing the order, the petitioner moved the high court. He wanted the court to quash the order of the police. Admitting the petition, Justice M.M. Sundresh directed notice to the authorities and posted the matter to January 19 for further hearing.
title: PMK moves HC for permission to conduct political meet
